intro: Uraspermum aristatum subsp. brevistyle, commonly known as the short-styled uraspermum, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. The subspecies brevistyle is distinguished by its shorter styles compared to other subspecies within the species.
